data.title: Empire State Building: 350 Fifth Ave, Office Space Availability
data.meta_description: Green, modern office space for rent is available at The Empire State Building at 350 Fifth Avenue. Lease office space in an NYC icon.
data.text:
Since 1931, the Empire State Building (350 Fifth Avenue) has stood as a timeless emblem of New York City, but it’s far from being a relic of the past. Recently, this iconic skyscraper underwent a massive $600 million transformation, successfully reinventing itself as a contemporary and dynamic business hub. With 2,816,025 square feet of cutting-edge Empire State Building office space for lease, it’s an ideal location for businesses seeking both prestige and modern amenities in Midtown Manhattan. You get so much for what you pay for: a famous address, an upgraded, environmentally-friendly skyscraper, a gym, great views, and great value.

Over 65,000 S.F. of Exclusive Empire State Building Amenities Await You

A comprehensive 15,000-square-foot fitness center.

A multi-purpose 10,000-square-foot lounge featuring a basketball court, pickleball court, and two golf/VR simulators.

An exclusive conference center on the 67th floor, ideal for high-profile meetings and panoramic views.

A selection of eight dining venues, including the unique Starbucks Reserve and the elegant STATE Grill and Bar.

Premium Tenant Amenities Across The Campus Properties

When you become a tenant at Empire State Building, you’ll gain immediate access to ‘The Campus’ amenities. This includes the 150+ capacity rooftop at 1333 Broadway and the large town hall space at 1400 Broadway. With both properties also owned by Empire State Realty Trust, you’ll have expanded options for business activities and events.

Empire State Building: Leading the Way in Sustainable Real Estate

The Empire State Building’s advanced energy retrofit resulted in a 40% reduction in energy consumption. With an Energy Star rating of 86, the building is on a path to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2030, aligning with sustainability goals and green office space objectives.

Networking at New Heights: Elite Companies at the Empire State Building

When you lease office space at the Empire State Building, you rub shoulders with the who’s who of business. LinkedIn, Shutterstock, Expedia – they’re all here. Being in such a business hub offers unparalleled networking and collaboration opportunities.

Prime Manhattan Location: Empire State Building’s Accessibility
